courseDescription:
This workplace safety course begins by introducing you to behavior-based safety and how to develop a culture of safety among employees. You will learn how to recognize the signs of drug use and how to implement workplace policies to maintain a drug-free workplace. The lessons will also cover workstation ergonomics where you will learn tips and techniques on maintaining good posture at workstations. This will ensure long-term comfort and back safety for all concerned.

As you progress with the course, you will gain a thorough understanding of key safety aspects such as risk analysis, hazard identification and control, and safety education and training. We will also make sure that you learn best practice policies for the implementation of effective safety programs. To provide a better overview of these lessons, we will also take a case study that focuses on the management of health and safety in schools.

Sometimes, people panic when emergencies at work arise. But if you have an in-depth knowledge of the important aspects of workplace safety and health, then this panic can be averted. This is why the Diploma in Workplace Safety and Health is crucial for anyone wishing to attain certification or gain a greater understanding of health and safety management. So check out the free online course and create a better environment in your workplace now.

Start Course Now

modules.details: The Basics of Behaviour Based Safety
modules.description: In this module, you are given an introduction to behaviour based safety. You will learn what behaviour is and what is involved in behaviour based safety. You will also learn how a behaviour based safety programme forms part of a wider safety culture.
topics: The Basics of Behaviour Based Safety - Learning Outcomes
Safety Cultures and The Safety Cycle
The Basics of Behaviour Based Safety - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: The Team and Behaviour Based Safety
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about the roles and responsibilities of the supervisor and employee when it comes to behaviour based safety. You will learn about factors that cause incidents and influence behaviour and about the importance of observing behaviour. You will discover how effective reinforcement and motivational techniques encourage good behaviour. You will learn how transactional analysis can be a useful tool for supervisors and team leaders.
topics: The Team and Behaviour Based Safety - Learning Outcomes
Your Role as a Supervisor or Team Leader
Understanding Your Team and Its Behaviour
The Team and Behaviour Based Safety - Lesson Summary

modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to ergonomics, and to the factors affecting workstation ergonomics. This module will explain what ergonomics is and how it can be used to improve the way you use your computer workstation. BY studying this module, you will be able to identify the key factors that affect workstation ergonomics.

modules.description: In this module, you will learn about using a visual display unit (VDU) and other equipment. You will be able to recognise the key factors for effective VDU use and you will also learn to identify the types of equipment that can create an ergonomic workstation.
topics: Designing an Ergonomic Workstation - Learning Outcomes

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about the physical and environmental factors affecting workstation ergonomics. You will be able recognise the physical and environmental factors that impact on an ergonomic workstation. This module presents a case study concerning ergonomic workstation design which will help you learn to choose appropriate solutions to ergonomic problems in a workplace.
